solution.text:
The first number that is divisible by _{k}_ in the deck is _{k}_
Second number is _{{k*2}}_
the last number will be _{{j/k}}_
this series of cards to be removed forms an AP
where \(a_1=_{k}_\) and \(d=_{k}_\)
to find the total number of terms in this AP we find the position of the last term _{{(j/k)*k}}_
\(a_n=a_1+(n-1)d\)
\(_{{(j/k)*k}}_=_{k}_+(n-1)*_{k}_\)
\((_{{(j/k)*k}}_-_{k}_)/_{k}_+1=n\)
\(n=_{{(j/k)-1}}_+1\)
\(n=_{{j/k}}_\)

content.text:
A deck of cards contains _{j}_ cards. A unique number from 1 to _{j}_ is written on each card.
Gopal hates all the numbers which are divisible by _{k}_
So he removes all such cards from the deck.
How many cards are removed from the deck.
